website_summaries.verdict: A smaller stove compact enough to use while backpacking, yet still reflective of the brand's excellence in camping gear.
pros: Burner heats even a larger pot or pan evenly, with 3 hours of cook time in one propane tank
Only weighs a couple of pounds, so very easy to transport
Temperature control works better than on some of the 2-burner stoves
cons: Needs a flat, stable surface to work correctly
No shields included to protect burner from the wind

customer_reviews.title: it is super efficient! One tiny propane tank lasts for weeks ...
customer_reviews.text: I live in a van and use this almost daily to cook with. it is super efficient! One tiny propane tank lasts for weeks even when this is used all of the time. Only issue is that the metal on the part where you screw the tank in is a little cheap and slowly seems to be stripping even though I take good care of it
customer_reviews.author: Aziza

customer_reviews.title: Good Value
customer_reviews.text: Decent price, I take a large pan from Costco and it holds PERFECTLY. A ignition striker would be nice but not a deal breaker just rest your pan on top to trap the fumes and hit the lighter. Flame control is a little odd: you have good control for a half-turn or so and then it's maxed out but you can still turn it quite a bit but it won't go higher. Max flame is good enough it just reaches it quickly on the dial. Still love it though
customer_reviews.author: Michael Briones

customer_reviews.title: Huge single burner; not like the one that goes on the top of the propane bottle
customer_reviews.text: I bought this one thinking it might be similar to the one that goes on top of the propane bottle. It is not. The stove is huge with a wide surface and I am loving it for car camping. I rarely need the double burner, but always hated the propane top version which could tilt and did not provide much support for the pan or pot. This is the exact opposite. Wide pan support area, solid metal construction, and super flame control. No windscreen, but I never had one anyway nor do I find them effective. Finding the right place to setup a kitchen is more important. In all, a bomber of a stove.
customer_reviews.author: outwest

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: I got this as a back up to campfire cooking (after having to continually chop wood pellets to feed a cooking fire in the rainforest- not fun). It works beautifully. I love that you can adjust the heat, and it’s quite a sturdy set up. I got it as a back up, but enjoyed it so much it’s become a staple. My favorite thing is begging able to brew morning coffee with very little effort :)
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly

customer_reviews.title: Awesome stove with good variability of flame/heat
customer_reviews.text: Many of these stoves do not provide good variability but this one does. It can go from a tiny flame to large, quick heating flame and very controllable in-between. The wide base makes it sit very stable and it holds small to large pots/pans well. I'm very pleased with it's performance but do wish it come in a rigid plastic storage case, as do many of the butane stoves, for easier and safer storage.
customer_reviews.author: BeeJ

customer_reviews.title: Color is BLACK, not Coleman GREEN!!
customer_reviews.text: I just received this and haven't used it yet. Just wanted to let you know that the one I received is BLACK and not Coleman GREEN, like the heading says it is. I almost didn't buy this because I didn't want green. 5 stars is based on my expectations, not use. I bought it to have something that I can take out easily to make a cup of tea or a quick meal when we have power outages. I found the propane cylinders on sale for $3.99 each at my local grocery store. Just look in the picnic supply/BBQ section.
customer_reviews.author: rickyfanmdr

customer_reviews.title: Test this product promptly
customer_reviews.text: I didn't try this stove until we were ready to leave for our camping trip, when I discovered it was defective. I could hear the gas, the match flame brightened and blew back on my fingers, but the burner wouldn't light. I had to make a quick trip to walmart to get a different stove for our weekend. Unfortunately when I got home and came here on amazon to request to return it I discovered the return window closed on Saturday while we were camping, so now I am stuck with a useless stove. Edited to say amazon did let me return after i contacted customer service, thankfully.
customer_reviews.author: Karen McLaren

customer_reviews.title: High Heat and usable burner.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Lots of BTUs, big space fits almost all pots and pans. Always cleans off well after making a mess. Cons: Underside heat reflector is sharp, it WILL cut you if you're not careful while washing the stove. The knob to adjust the flame level takes some getting used to, it goes High-High-High-High-High-Medium-Low/off, so you have to learn how to turn it down and control the heat in a small range of the knob;s motion.
customer_reviews.author: Evan Lazer

customer_reviews.title: Highly efficient burner.
customer_reviews.text: Great single stove! Highly efficient burner. Percolated my coffee way faster than the Coleman BBQ grill. And yes, it works with the Coleman collapsible oven (please see photos).
customer_reviews.author: Michael D. King

customer_reviews.title: This item is perfect: big enough for a large skillet orl can ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as a more compact way to have a burner for camping. I have one of the traditional two burner coleman stoves and seem to never need both burners and it's bigger, bulkier and heavier. This item is perfect: big enough for a large skillet orl can support a small pot without fear of rocking around. Really gets hot and I've nad no trouble dialing it down to a low heat for simmering. I did use a couple of old flat baking sheets as a windbreak since this item does not have any.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice and stable, well made.
customer_reviews.text: Bigger than I expected, but in a good way. Got this to place on our glass-top electric stove and use for cooking in an emergency during a power outage. Technically I'm sure you're supposed to only use it outside, but the 1lb propane cylinders are legal to at least store inside, and as long as you're not leaving this running for hours, I'm sure the by-products of frying an egg probably outweigh the by-products of the propane burned to cook it.
customer_reviews.author: NetMagi

customer_reviews.title: Simple and amazing!
customer_reviews.text: I couldn’t be happier with this stove. It is so simple...Just screw on the metal tube that connects the propane, screw on the propane canister, open the valve, and light! Really puts out a lot of heat, has a very stable flame, is lightweight and stable. No complaints whatsoever. After struggling with a traditional Coleman white gasoline camp stove for years, I would never go back.
customer_reviews.author: Senor Hotcell

customer_reviews.title: Good product but not for backpacking.
customer_reviews.text: I got this product for the use of multi-day trekking and being light. I also got it because I have coleman propane and obviously can't take a double burner on a trekk. Other more compact fire burners offer what I was looking for but decided to give Coleman a try. This is a wonderful product and perfect for camping especially when cooking with bigger pots.. Not ideal for overnight hiking and multi-day backpacking, but ideal for family camping. It doesn't have any protection against wind which is something I prefer for the two burner stove.
customer_reviews.author: EsmaBee

customer_reviews.title: Good price, useful
customer_reviews.text: Took it camping to EAA in Oshkosh. We used to use a little stove but needed something bigger to save time when cooking. This heated food quickly, was very hot, had a good price, and was not too big. I strongly recommend. This flame coming out of multiple homes was also really nice because they would reignite once another I'd once side went or die too wind almost instantly.
customer_reviews.author: Mo Jones

customer_reviews.title: Easy to control, compact burner
customer_reviews.text: It’s a very controllable single burner. I bought mine for hurricane preparedness. It’ll work for whenever I need a single burner. I’m pretty happy with the amount of flame control I have, and the wire frame is reasonably sturdy, so it holds pots full of water. I’m not going g to use this every day, but it seems durable enough for my purposes
customer_reviews.author: Keith Robicheux

customer_reviews.title: Missing Connecting Rod Part
customer_reviews.text: This purchase is useless to me because until today, I did not know that the connector rod to be used between the Propane gas canister and the camp stove was missing. I went to a ACE Hardware store to find a hose to use and they had this stove and opened the box and there is a rod that transfers the gas from the canister to the stove.
customer_reviews.author: Molly H

customer_reviews.title: Trouble with connecting Arm
customer_reviews.text: Less than a month the connecting arm doesn’t work well. You have to push the propane arm into the connecting copper colored slot in order for the gas to work. Now I need to light and push arm connector with one hand in order for it to light. Made coffee with one hand and Mac n cheese with one hand while holding pushing arm. Not fun.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome stove for car camping
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for camping in my van. Used it last week to cook outdoors at Yosemite and it worked awesomely. We were able to put a huge 10 quart pot and it produced a lot of heat and the soup heated up quickly, then we turned it down to steam some buns. The fine temperature adjustment worked perfectly. I would consider a second stove for the van so we can get 2 dishes cooking at the same time. Highly recommend this stove.
customer_reviews.author: Eric B.

customer_reviews.title: Ok but a bit awkward
customer_reviews.text: I find the way the bottle is mounted a pain when I'm trying to use this in a small space in my camper van. Its easy to use outside at a campsite. The problem I have with it is the feet on the edges that hold the wires keep falling off. Im thinking of supergluing them but then I could not take it apart to clean it.
customer_reviews.author: UnityInDuality

customer_reviews.title: Good enough I reordered a second one
customer_reviews.text: It is wide enough and sturdy enough to put my five quart dutch oven full of water on it. About the same size as the burner on my gas stove - not nearly as powerful though. The burner itself sits firmly and directly on the table. After I received it, I ordered a second one for my friend.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Super little stove!
customer_reviews.text: I am retired and travel full time. Had used the Coleman Bottle Top Burner for several years, but was getting worn out, and it was unstable at times....but this new Coleman stove is much more stable, and lower on in height. Cooking is much easier now! I LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.author: John D. Lamb

customer_reviews.title: A lifesaver after a hurricane
customer_reviews.text: I gave the stove to my girlfriend who was involved in Hurricane Irma and she is been cooking for her family on this one burner for a week now. it has been very functional and very good. She is very happy with the stove. it was a lifesaver for she and her family after the hurricane. They were able to eat tasty warm food when the alternative if they did not have the stove would have been miserable.
customer_reviews.author: Thawyzard

customer_reviews.title: Great heat
customer_reviews.text: This produces plenty of heat. It takes a little to get used to the heat control knob. I was cooking with it out side on bright sunny days and was difficult to see the flame. An improvement Coleman could do is make the arrow for increasing the heat a different color than the knob. I'll be painting my arrow white on the black knob. Works so good I got a second one.
customer_reviews.author: Chevy250

customer_reviews.title: Great minimalist camping stove
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for camping trips. I used to haul around my two-burner stove but it was just so big and I wanted to downsize the amount of stuff I bring on our camping trip. This works great. Easy set-up. So much lighter than the Coleman two-burner stove. It's also very stable. I set this up on a boulder because we didn't have tables. The stove didn't slide off the boulder. Definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for 1-2 person camp stove.
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect for a single or even 2-person camping trip... easy to use, dirty, then wipe clean... NOT a good backpacking camp stove (hope that is obvious). It has a decently compact footprint. I'd like to see if I could get a canvas bag that this would fit in rather than use the cardboard box. Two of these for a 3-5 person camp trip would probably work well. ...and I think that is all that needs to be said about that.
customer_reviews.author: Capin

customer_reviews.title: Ragnar must have
customer_reviews.text: This is the 2nd one I have bought. Love it. I can percolate coffee fast and cook everything with it. Temp control is nice and it puts out heat quick enough that cold water is coffee before runner/campers get grouchy.
customer_reviews.author: Scott B. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Made to be Inexpensive.
customer_reviews.text: There are no wind screens like there are on the Coleman double burner, and that turned out to be important. The jets never seemed to burn on high. There was lots of range on the control knob, but the flame adjusted to low or high, and high was not that high. I'd send it back if I could, but took it on an RV trip and didn't get to it within return time.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: 1 spill = 1 ruined, uncleanable stove.
customer_reviews.text: Useless after a single spill. Served me pretty well for about two months, but now, after spilling a bit of green bean juice, it puts out an orange flame, indicateing a disbalance in gas out put and gas burning. To kick it off into Annoyingland, USA, they designed this thing so that its impossible to get in there and clean it out, which I estimate would solve my problem. I am saddened and disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Kenin M. Rekr

customer_reviews.title: Decent but not for boiling large amounts of water fast
customer_reviews.text: It's not a flame thrower that boils water in 30 seconds but it is a decent side burner that will eventually get water boiled. I tried to boil about 2 gallons of water and it took quite a while with this. It is decent though. Easy setup and lit right up. No complaints other than it not being able to boil a lot of water fast.
customer_reviews.author: John H.

customer_reviews.title: Small, Durable, Camping Stove. Best value.
customer_reviews.text: This little stove is small, but durable. And powerful enough to boil even large pots quickly. We just took a two-week road trip through the Southwest; a long camping trip. We used this stove for breakfast and dinner basically every night and had no problems with it at all. It boiled water for coffee and oatmeal in the mornings without a problem. And it was able to heat up a cast iron skillet for dinner. It is clearly well made and stout. We didn't have any issues with construction or design. My wife wanted somewhat finer control over the very low-end of the heat range. But it was only a minor issue, and we still think we got a bargain.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Back Country Stove
customer_reviews.text: This stove works great for horse packing. it is light and large top so you don't feel like pans are going to come off. Work great and easy to set up. This is the second one we have purchase. Got one for my stock trailer. Heats a large pot of water with no wobbling. Heats it fast.
customer_reviews.author: Mongoose

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy base for heavy pots
customer_reviews.text: it is a bit larger than what I thought but it is very solid and handles my heavy Lodge dutch oven without any wobble. Very nice and solid cooker.
customer_reviews.author: zugvogel

customer_reviews.title: Very handy and powerful.
customer_reviews.text: This burner came in very handy in a recent remodel. It is very powerful and boils water in no time. It's easy to use and store. This item is a must for power outages as well as for camping, for which it was intended. Of course, you have to take care not to turn the knob without a lighting source to avoid leaking propane, but that's just common sense. This is my third one, since I have gifted it to others. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: H Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Cooks Great
customer_reviews.text: I like the small size and light weight but the setup and tear down is a bit of pain. It makes heat and cooks what I need. No way I'm leaving it setup outside overnight to attract critters. A windscreen is a must in any wind.
customer_reviews.author: JimSaid

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't come with propane
customer_reviews.text: We grabbed this because we were camping rookies and weren't confident about using the fire to even heat water. All I used it for was heating water in a kettle but it worked like a champ. Easy to assemble but directions are less than awesome. It doesn't come with propane so you will need to add that to your cart as well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So Glad I Invested In This Stove
customer_reviews.text: Yes, yes, yes to this stove. Easy to light, and heat can be turned to a very low flame if the knob is turned gently and with a bit of finesse. Loved it so much, I got another one. It is sturdy enough to hold a 12" cast iron skillet. No more cooking over the campfire for us.
customer_reviews.author: Dee

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Design.
customer_reviews.text: This just what was expected. Right size , right fuel, and fits in a small fabric laptop case. Highly recommend. If I am cooking bacon, crawfish or anything that might cause too odor I use this outside. Perfect for me.
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: Incredible one burner propane stove
customer_reviews.text: Great for car camping. Heat adjustment squeezes last bit of propane out of bottle, very efficient. Allows pans and pots to remain stable without fear of movement or tipping. Have single burner Coleman heater from 20 years plus ago that is more backpack worthy due to size but had to hold pot or pan to prevent spilling off flat surface. This unit is backpack worthy but takes up more space in width (car camped with it only so far). Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Stands up to wind
customer_reviews.text: This little burner is great. It is powerful, heating up water or food fast. Even though there is no wind shielding, I have had no issues with the flame going out in fairly windy conditions. The only thing I would change is it would be nice to have its own ignition source.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Stable, good heat output, easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: My only complaint about this unit is that it's a bit challenging to get the flame at a low heat. The adjustment knob is very touchy at the lowest point. Otherwise I really like it. It sure heats up really fast and the unit is stable, both sitting on the table and for supporting pots/pans. Super easy to use too.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: This is awesome
customer_reviews.text: Amazing for traveling!! Light weight, very portable & works awesome!!
customer_reviews.author: Keith B.

customer_reviews.title: Decent, but rather large
customer_reviews.text: I was anticipating this burner to be smaller than other coleman burners. I didn't anticipate how large it is. If you're looking for a single burner, then this is for you. Because of its size, it looks really stable. Stability is important, too, as the propane tank is attached to the side of the burner. You don't want the burner flipping up when you take the pan off, and this looks like it will definitely stay put. Coleman's burners are quite reliable, especially if you are using the throwaway coleman propane canisters. Highly recommended. I sent this back though because I was looking for something smaller.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Riel

customer_reviews.title: Solid purchase
customer_reviews.text: Love this thing. Added it to my car camping kit because the Coleman 2 burner stove was just too bulky and never seemed to need the second burner.
customer_reviews.author: pat

customer_reviews.title: Seems legit except for the thin sheet of metal on the bottom
customer_reviews.text: U have to be careful when picking I up because there is a really thin piece of sheet metal on the bottom with no support for some reason. I don't know it's purpose and I'm not feeling like messing with a gas stove so I pick it up very carefully.
customer_reviews.author: VOID

customer_reviews.title: Compact Camping Must-Have
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size for camping. I try to purchase compact camping gear and this worked perfectly. We are a family of 4 with two dogs. I used this to make tacos and soup. It warmed up pretty fast and was stable. No issues with the grate as all the cookware I used fit perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Arlene

customer_reviews.title: Best one burner propane camp stove
customer_reviews.text: This was our second purchase of this stove. If you need a propane stove...GET IT! Ours finally died after four years of nearly daily use. Even then it was a leaky stem. The rest of the stove (burner, adapter, controls) all still worked. This is the best propane stove I have used in my 58 years.
customer_reviews.author: NorCal Customer

customer_reviews.title: Better then a electric stove
customer_reviews.text: The product is great cooks fast use it as a home stove right now the propane last about a month maybe less depending on how much you cook. The only thing that I dont like is the connection threads for the propane seem like it wont last but it's still working for now
customer_reviews.author: jeffrey l.

customer_reviews.title: Great for our smoker
customer_reviews.text: I use this in our smoker under a cast iron pan holding the chips or chunks. Works like a charm. The element burns out after a couple of years. Nevertheless, for under $30, this is a great buy. Ribs turn out great everytime.
customer_reviews.author: AHK

customer_reviews.title: Car camping luxury
customer_reviews.text: Simple, stable, brings the heat! The feed tube tucks under 2 pot supports and the whole thing (without the gas bottle but including a generous folding windscreen and piezo lighter) fits exactly in a cloth bag. Set it up on the tailgate and we're cooking in no time.
customer_reviews.author: Karl F. Riemer

customer_reviews.title: Very poor control over burner output makes it hard to use ...
customer_reviews.text: Very poor control over burner output makes it hard to use for anything other than boiling water. It is very difficult to simmer, cook pancakes, etc due poor low range. Limited compatibility with small cookware(<4" diameter).
customer_reviews.author: Rainy Dan

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, but not perfect single burner stove.
customer_reviews.text: Like most Coleman products, this one is top notch. The only improvements that Coleman should make are: find a way to keep the rubber feet from falling off while it is packed in my camping gear in the car, and supply a carrying bag so the gas fitting never gets separated from the stove. Also, because the flame adjusting is so sensitive, it makes it difficult to keep a low flame for a good simmer.
customer_reviews.author: Steve McC

customer_reviews.title: Works just fine
customer_reviews.text: Cooked some steaks on a cast iron pan while camping. Like other reviews to control knob inst all that controlling. The first quarter of a turn gives you some control but the rest does not do anything. Still works for my steak and coffee!!
customer_reviews.author: Bryce S. Hart

customer_reviews.title: Great car camping stove.
customer_reviews.text: Very powerful burner. Water boils very fast with this. It is light weight but a bit bulky. Great for car camping or live stock camping but not backpacking. Can manage big pots and pans. A bit tricky with small medal cups or pans to boil water.
customer_reviews.author: H. A. Price

customer_reviews.title: Versatile!
customer_reviews.text: We really like this single burner stove. It is perfect for a cast iron skillet, and when we use 2 of these we can place our large griddle on top. Seems more compact and versatile than our heavier camping stove.
customer_reviews.author: SavyThinker

customer_reviews.title: Useless
customer_reviews.text: It produces a flame, but it will not provide enough heat to boil water or to heat oil high enough to fry. A waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Pastor Maynard

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised -- nothing more, nothing less.
customer_reviews.text: I want slightly stronger flames, but realize 7500 BTUs isn't much. This stove is good for simmering or basic cooking, but it does not provide enough heat to sear meat or to heat up a wok for stir fry. This is a good stove for portability and to make simple dishes.
customer_reviews.author: NytWolf

customer_reviews.title: Perfect! Heats up a 8x13 tray of italian beef ...
customer_reviews.text: Perfect! Heats up a 8x13 tray of italian beef in about 5 minutes. Much better to purchase off Amazon as most other outlets consider it to be a bulk item and require more shipping.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Mustradi

customer_reviews.title: BUY THIS TODAY!
customer_reviews.text: What an awesome purchase! We bought this for a camping trip and I could not be happier. So easy to use and heats up quickly and evenly. Cools down quickly and cleans easy for storing. HIGHLY recommend this for anyone looking to purchase a stove top.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Outdoor equipment
customer_reviews.text: When I received the box, I felt so heavy. I opened it and looked at it. It was very delicate. I used it once and it was very practical for outdoor camping.
customer_reviews.author: lisha

customer_reviews.title: This a nice unit and brings water to a boil fast
customer_reviews.text: This a nice unit and brings water to a boil fast. Set up and clean up is easy and it has a small profile so it does not need much space. In the instructions it said a 1lb propane canister will last 3 hours on the maximum which is good in my view.
customer_reviews.author: O. K. Maharaj

customer_reviews.title: What a relief
customer_reviews.text: Life saver. We have PG&E outages now. and I use this for making coffee on deck in the morning. Just pretend I am camping. Easy to use. Well made. Can always trust Coleman. A+A+A+A+
customer_reviews.author: MJMB

customer_reviews.title: Efficient and powerful
customer_reviews.text: Very surprised with both the power and the fuel efficiency of this stove. Went on a 2 week trip where I used this thing for probably half of my meals, some of which were things requiring significant cooking times. I bought 4 tanks for it, and didn't even finish the first one. Could also boil large pots of water in minutes. Great stove
customer_reviews.author: Cameron

customer_reviews.title: Dinner will be ready soon.
customer_reviews.text: For when the power goes out, you can still cook in a big pot.
customer_reviews.author: The hunter.

customer_reviews.title: Good Little 1-Burner!
customer_reviews.text: This stove is lightweight, lights easily and has good heat output. The only issue is that you can’t see the flame once it’s lit and it doesn’t make much of a sound, so it’s hard to tell if it’s lit or not.
customer_reviews.author: Cache

customer_reviews.title: Great outside burner
customer_reviews.text: Great outside burner. I got this mostly for cooking steak and sea food. It can get very hot of searing meat. We are full time RVers and You can't cook real hot in the 5th wheel without setting the fire alarm off so I use this out side on the table and it works perfectly. Gets very hot on high which is great for searing meats. Has a controllable dial from warm to screeching hot. Will heat a 12 to 14 inch pan perfectly. Get it you'll like it!
customer_reviews.author: Cindy Flesher

customer_reviews.title: Great single burner stove for convenient packing/quick camping trip when ...
customer_reviews.text: Great single burner stove for convenient packing/quick camping trip when you don't feel like lugging around the big 2 burner stove. However this is larger than I expected, definitely not for backpacking (about +12" in diameter & maybe 3-5 lbs without propane tank). Doesn't have great control over the heat (I saw no difference between "high" & "low") and has no lighter push button. Worked great for a quick one-pan dinner & making coffee in the morning.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Much larger than I thought and it's very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Much larger than I thought and it's very sturdy, I put all my cast iron pans on it and they fit great even my large skillet and square griddle. Their are many different kinds of camp stoves, but this is one of the most compact (for a full size grill) and used the cheapest fuel (about $2.50/bottle@walmart) which will last about 3hrs a piece. I use one for camping and one for melting lead and casting bullets and it works very well for that. You won't be disappointed so enjoy.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful stove. I run a 20 lb tank off it.
customer_reviews.author: Robert A.

customer_reviews.title: light weight and reliable stove
customer_reviews.text: I have had this for two years now and have used it about 10 times I would guess. I also find it difficult, but not impossible, to set to low heat and it has been a lot more reliable than the two induction stoves I have tried. It is large enough to be a stable platform for a 12" skillet and light enough to be packed anywhere, which makes it a much better solution than our the bulky heavy smallish burner/grill side by side coleman stove it is replacing. I just purchased a 2nd one so I can have two going at once.
customer_reviews.author: CPAChicago

customer_reviews.title: Good quality Coleman product.
customer_reviews.text: Works like a charm. Very compact while still being able to support a full size pan without fear of it tipping over and accepts the common larger 16.4 ounce bottles. Puts out enough heat to cook unless it's very windy, if the wind is high you need to find a windbreak but that is better than some camp stoves that even a slight breeze and you will use a full fuel bottle and your food will still not be cooked.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Kubrick

customer_reviews.title: Great for emergencies
customer_reviews.text: I bought this burner top for home use and it does the trick. It is relatively large based with soft rubber feet for stability. They protect your table or counter from damage. The lighting and adjustment is easy, and the only limitation is the lowest flame is too much for just a simmer. Best not used for small pans or skillets as the rack will not hold them without being prone to tipping over. Use medium and large size for best operation. In my opinion not durable enough to be kicked around and abused. Has vulnerable areas. Use the original cardboard box for storage.
customer_reviews.author: GrantV

customer_reviews.title: Great item if you don’t have a large grill.
customer_reviews.text: I have several propane-fueled burners. This one is less compact but still light weight. It has a temperature control. The only issue I have is you need an iron grill surface or other item to grill hot dogs, hamburgers, etc. it works well when using a skillet.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Collins

customer_reviews.title: Exceeds expectations
customer_reviews.text: I'm very happy with this stove. Great temp control. All it lacks is something to prevent a breeze or light winds from doubling your cooking time.
customer_reviews.author: Troy Teixeira

customer_reviews.title: This is PERFECT for my woks and pressure cookers
customer_reviews.text: Got this because I have a glass-top stove that won't work with some pans. This is PERFECT for my woks and pressure cookers, and it really puts out a lot of steady heat. A bottle of propane seems to last a long-long time. I've even used this, with precautions, for emergency heat and cooking during blizzard power outages. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: M. Stone

customer_reviews.title: Too big
customer_reviews.text: Alot bigger than I thought it would be. Thought it would be good to put in my backpack and carry but it's too big for that. Very sturdy though so good for full size pans or cast iron skillets.
customer_reviews.author: Danny

customer_reviews.title: Good stove
customer_reviews.text: This has a large, sturdy base and heats up quickly. It is lightweight, though, and a pleasure to use. I have used various pots/pans with it and all worked well. I recommend it. The only thing that is curious to me, since it is the first propane stove I have had, is that it is difficult to see the flames in the daytime outside. So I would say be careful until you understand that there actually is a fire burning, even if you can't see it. At night, no problem.
customer_reviews.author: MsTerry

customer_reviews.title: Just works....and portable
customer_reviews.text: For picnics/ camping/ emergencies Short and squat so its stable Holds my 12" cast iron skillet or griddle perfect Can upgrade hose to large LP bottle Nothing too fancy Just works....and portable
customer_reviews.author: Chris A.C.

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy construction propane stove
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy construction propane stove. Needed this for my 17" cast iron skillet. Bought 3 for me and my neighbors. Everyone loved these stoves. I this stove is built to last and a good addition to your 'preps'. Jim in Kentucky
customer_reviews.author: Jimnasium

customer_reviews.title: This thing works great! Absolutely no complaints
customer_reviews.text: This thing works great! Absolutely no complaints. Put my tea kettle on this while camping, and it heated up super quick. It was even a little too hot for our pancake pan... but not complaining at all. I will be able to use this for many years to come.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So simple to use and can take up to a 12-inch diameter pan
customer_reviews.text: East to use right out of the box. Heats things up fast; also can be turned down to a simmer OK, as long as the wind isn't blowing too hard, or you get a windscreen. The fuel canisters can be purchased at my local hardware store.
customer_reviews.author: AJL

customer_reviews.title: when the breeze blows away goes the heat
customer_reviews.text: works well most of the time. when there is a breeze you need to build a fort around this to get water to boil. worked for the trip we were on but i'll be looking to replace it before next summer's camping
customer_reviews.author: CanadianGoneSouth

customer_reviews.title: No temperature control
customer_reviews.text: It works, but that's about it. Temperature control is non-existent: it's either on full-blast, or off.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

customer_reviews.title: Won't work outdoors
customer_reviews.text: Flames simply goes out as soon I take this thing outside the cabin. Don't expect to cook anything on it. Instead buy a more sturdy unit that does't flame out in a little breeze.
customer_reviews.author: SL

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product, I Buy before for the Hurricanes Season
customer_reviews.text: Excellent Product, I Buy before for the Hurricanes Season, I Used one Small tank of Propane for 4 days made 3 meals at day, Excellent Product.
customer_reviews.author: Rafael

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Great for car camping. We cooked multiple times and felt that it heated evenly. Would absolutely buy again
customer_reviews.author: Finley Wynters

customer_reviews.title: Good, Large propane burner
customer_reviews.text: This is a large burner - one that can easily accommodate much larger pots or pans than my compact 2-burner Coleman stove. It works as advertised - easy to light and easy to adjust the flame. It connects easily to a 16.4 oz propane cylinder. Take note of the product dimensions. This is not a small, backpacking stove. It should work well for car camping, or other uses needing a large portable burner.
customer_reviews.author: Blind Lemon Pie

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Control knob range of adjustment is poor. Goes to full blast before a quarter turn.
customer_reviews.author: A. Parsons

customer_reviews.title: Could be hotter
customer_reviews.text: My wife says that the size of this burner is great, but the maximum amount of heat produced is marginal.
customer_reviews.author: misfitsailor

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and easy to take with
customer_reviews.text: This little one burner stove was all I needed in my travels. Easy to setup, easy to use and easy to store away in small spaces. I wish there was a little more temperature control for a low setting when you want to just keep something simmering while setting up the rest of the meal.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to store, very good rack for most size pans. Dependable.
customer_reviews.text: Been using this model for 4 years now. Bought this one for cooking at home so I can leave the other in RV. Love this stove.
customer_reviews.author: cfc

customer_reviews.title: Safe, stable, and easy to control
customer_reviews.text: We did a lot of shopping around for a small and easy to use car camping stove that ran off of propane and discovered this to be the best one available. We've used it on a couple of trips now and very happy we went with this one because it is very stable and easy to control the flame. There are cheaper options but I do think this is the best on the market.
customer_reviews.author: Daryle

customer_reviews.title: Fine simple stove.
customer_reviews.text: Good stable stove, fairly large about12" in diameter. Pots between 4" and 11.5" inches of diameter will fit. If you want something compact, this is not it. Good for cooking for a family while camping.
customer_reviews.author: I.B.

customer_reviews.title: works
customer_reviews.text: disliked aluminum threaded connector for bottle,easy to cross thread,used grease on threads helps alot.
customer_reviews.author: R Cannon

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for camping
customer_reviews.text: Nice size stove with good heat control. Light weight for the RV.
customer_reviews.author: Art

customer_reviews.title: So easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: Truthfully I am one of those people who is kinda afraid of gas/flames, and always had trouble lighting my older camping stoves for fear of burning my fingers trying to light it. Not so with this product! The open grill makes it incredibly easy to light, and the whole process of getting it set up and on is incredibly smooth and easy. Additionally, I am very happy with how sturdy and portable it is. I would definitely recommend this to friends!!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanierunsforfun

customer_reviews.title: steady base, even flame
customer_reviews.text: tipping a pot of boiling water over is not my idea of fun. Granted, you're not going to use this if you are a 25-lb back packer, but that's not me. -fast boil -easy setup -dense flame heat handles a small can -stable, cradles a large stockpot -uses the common gas cans
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for van life
customer_reviews.text: This was exactly what I was looking for. Takes up less space compared to the two burner stove, has flame adjustment and great portability. Perfect for vanlife
customer_reviews.author: dave

customer_reviews.title: I own a half dozen camp stoves and this is my favorite.
customer_reviews.text: This was a little larger than I expected but it is still more compact than the single stove that sits on top of a propane or any of my duel stoves. It is extremely stable compared to the one that sits on top of a propane tank and I can put one of the 8 quart pots on it with easy. I love using it with my 12 inch wok and it is compact since it is flat and no extra stand piece to carry. I wish I bought this sooner and not my other single propane burner.
customer_reviews.author: Chico

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful extra heat source
customer_reviews.text: Very, very handy camping. We have ac2 burner, but a dedicated larger size burner is wonderful. Works great!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: has nob for flame control and is easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: this is very handy for camping, it allows you another cooking surface, turns on right away, has nob for flame control and is easy to clean. You should always have a back-up bottle of propane ....

product_meta.title: Coleman PowerPack Propane Stove, Single Burner, Coleman Green - 2000020931
product_meta.description:
A handy cooking companion for camping and outdoor adventures, the Coleman PowerPack Propane Stove, Single Burner, combines performance with an ultra-portable design. This camping stove fits a large 12-inch pan on its steady base and pot support system. The portable stove comes equipped with an adjustable burner that lets you precisely control the cooking temperature and lasts up to 3 hours on high on one 16.4 oz. propane cylinder (sold separately). PerfectFlow pressure-control technology delivers steady heat output while cooking, and PerfectHeat technology promotes efficient fuel usage. When mealtime is over, the durable chrome-plated grate is removable for easy cleaning. Perfect for camping, backpacking, and other outdoor occasions, this compact camp stove is designed to produce up to 7,500 total BTUs of cooking power from a single 3-inch burner, giving you the ability to prepare a wide range of hot foods at the campsite.

AMAZON.COM
The Coleman 5453A700 Powerpack Single-burner Low-profile Propane Stove is pretty much as easy as it gets. The Powerpack's fully adjustable flame lets you boil water or simmer chili, while the PerfectFlow system of pressure-regulated propane provides consistent cooking performance (without flaring or flickering) by producing a steady fuel stream, even in cold weather, high altitudes, or when fuel is low.

 This Coleman stove is constructed of an aluminized-steel cooktop and removable, nickel-chrome grates so you spend your time on the trail instead of on cleanup duty. The large 3.25-inch, 7,500 BTU burner is to the side of the propane cylinder in a low-profile fashion that ensures this burner will always be one of Coleman's easiest and best.

 Manufacturer Warranty
Limited lifetime warranty
